I was also surprised at the side of the shrimp. The menu called them "giant" and they weren't very giant. However, everything was delicious and the service was excellent! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Mango margarita, so delicious!

tUbQoJM8xKLdrmGE35bQkw.text: They were extremely kind to us on my anniversary and even gave us the choice of a couple of tables when we called ahead of time. Anyone who has been here knows how busy it gets so having the choice of where to sit made a very good impression on me. They made the evening extra special with the addition of churros and tequila (can't really go wrong there!). My only reason for taking away 1 star is because some of the items on the menu could be a little better. I've had better chili relleno at other places. I would definitely go back though...their margaritas are the best!

9CSfrIEwudHc0tUfiZQl2A.text: This restaurant has a great view of the city. The food is excellent and the service is good. The only downside is it's Sooooo busy all the time.

m2ldXDesd_2RD_49Q_e_EQ.text: Food was pretty good but it was a tad bit burned and the serious was simply "alright." I've been to the one on dessert inn and pecos and that one is so much more constant with their service and quality of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Let&#39;s eat!!

xQxvXjz02tiI3pFa-dCHfw.text: After several visits to this place I'm still not the biggest fan.  Everything seems just ok.   I will say the view is incredible.  Getting a table along the windows give you the scenic overview of the city with the strip in sight.  Service during the lunch hour is solid.  They were good about refills with several different people checking on our table.    We decided to split the Queso and Chicken Fajitas.  The Queso hardened up quickly. You pretty much had a lump of cheese after the first minute it's sitting on the table.  The chorizo mixed in gave it a good flavor but I wish it was a bit more creamy so it could be dip worthy for longer.    I wish I would have known their Fajitas had cilantro covering the entire plate.  Usually fajitas have a good seasoning without mixing in cilantro on top of it.  I can handle some but it was excessive.  The shells served with it weren't the regular fajita size but almost burrito size. For what I prefer this dish was just ok.    I can always find something else to try but Lindo wouldn't be my first choice for Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chips/salsa/bean dip
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Queso Fundido with chorizo

gFCBF4L3GWhAW33DzuOerA.text: Use to love this place but then they changed the salsa.  So I now I have to travel to the desert inn location.

_kPEwVORyPhngKV--ACK2Q.text: Absolutely love this place!  The table side guacamole and the playa azul are my favorites. The dishes are always consistent and of high quality.

MxSA1Z0sS_VrzwFEQf2E7Q.text: Celebrated my birthday here last week and my entire experience was incredible! This has been my first experience at this location, and I must say it will not be my last.   The servers are beyond kind and very personable! But it saddens me to take away a star; this is only because when the food came out, it was not hot - just warm. Granted - we did have a large group! So it can get difficult getting everything out at once I suppose. Regardless, everything tasted wonderful and the drinks were just as fantastic. You get chips and salsa as you wait for you're meal, and enjoy their delicious margaritas ;) If you request for a seat by the back windows, you can get a lovely view outside too.   Overall, very memorable evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. THESE GUYS WERE SO FUN.
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Birthday shot! (3...)
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Delicious enchilada w/ side of rice and beans.

vHggNCAX_oQkQWThvsxBrA.text: My husband and I ate here for the first time tonight. The service was impeccable! Our server was Miguel, and the busser for our section was just as attentive. If anything got low: water, chips, salsa, drinks, it was like they were standing around a corner with refills. I couldn't have asked for better or more kind service. The food however was mediocre at best and the restaurant was REALLY WARM. I think my favorite part of it all was the frozen strawberry margarita. We probably won't be back for food, but thank you to the staff for working so hard to bring great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

0SQEfjcqjqPebgpFe-m9jQ.text: The food was great , the service was spectacular , i highly recommed this place . I ordered thr tilapia dish and it was SO GOOD . The servers were on top of everything . 5 stars all the way

Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

9BN_saKoYnN-AuQ-U_7A3w.text: I live in Henderson and this is one of my absolute favorite spots. Great view overlooking the city and if you go on a weekday night you may have the opportunity to sit next to the window to get the best view. (Great place for a romantic date to kiss while overlooking the crazy city life happening beneath you). Not sure why this place doesn't already have five stars or more because the food, drinks, view and service are superb!  I was lucky enough to witness a birthday song and dance accompanied by a sombrero hat for the birthday girl at the table right behind me!!  What a great night!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

soLFSM80dwovF4j3S98CDQ.text: This was our first time visiting, it's a bit overpriced, but with that being said, the food was really good. The margaritas were delicious! The view and the service was absolutely perfect! I'll definitely come back for lunch prices or happy hour though.

G-c3UMjVtYhnTzL1sjdiXw.text: My family comes to this spot often. The welcome our family and we love it.. my kids like the soupita...

47JEGqpb5937HdG2P9L-nA.text: This place is absolutely the best! I didn't want to try it out in the first place but I am so happy I did. Even though it was an hour wait (totally worth it), the staff was attentive and fast! It was literally the best staff I have ever encountered. If I had hundreds of dollars to tip them, I would have!   The place was insanely busy and my water was STILL filled 5+ times. Since it was busy, it was noisy but it honestly didn't bother me. The atmosphere was incredibly fun because there was something happening in every corner. Music and "Happy Birthday" going off in every corner! We asked them to sing "Happy Birthday" to my aunt and a handful came over with a sombrero, put it on her head, started singing, and then gave her little tequila shots! It was the best ever.   I haven't even talked about the AMAZING food yet! It was hands down the best tacos I have ever had in my life. I have shrimp and carne asada tacos. I couldn't get over how delicious it was. The carne asada was perfectly flavored and just melted in my mouth. The shrimp was really to die for. It was also nice that they gave out beans with the chips and salsa.   If you want a relaxing day with amazing meal, I suggest coming on Sunday during lunch. I went again on Sunday after the crazy Friday night and it was more laid back. There was no wait and we had an amazing view of Las Vegas. The view would have been 10000x better at night with those lights but it was still great. The service was still A1. I also tried the ceviche was of course, great. I am weird with seafood but I trusted this place. I'm glad I did.  All in all, try this place out! You won't regret it.

QkViqU2NYRx6W3E0WIM2EQ.text: Being Mexican I'm always looking for good, close to authentic Mexican food.  Took mi madre to Lindo yesterday for Dia de las Madres. Place was absolutely packed!!! As we arrived we saw a pretty big line but no big deal, we knew this was a possibility. Hostess( don't remember her name, she's blonde ) asked if we had a reservation, I said "no, sorry girl" she rolled her eyes and said "of course" which I thought was a bit rude. I get it though, I work in the industry so sometimes we may come off rude unintentionally because we're busy. Our server was fantastic, food was excellent, vibe was great! Loved the mariachi! Oh and the delicious churros for dessert. All staff from manager, bussers, food runners and hostesses were on their total redbull and roller skates game! Good job y'all! Will be back for cocktails and a sick view soon!

2MQjyl7JGfnsBv56AXMWZw.text: Great view, Great food & Great service. Highly recommend for families or couples. This place has delicious Mexican food that is the closest to real on this side of town. Prices are decent and affordable. Margaritas are yummy.

TsMa49qXgRuwoYRipZG1tw.text: Went for a large party birthday dinner, had a reservation and it took much longer than scheduled time to be seated. Food and service was fantastic! Went back for happy hour days later and all tending the bar were amazing, margaritas superb, and food was again fantastic! Happy to have this establishment in our new neighborhood!

O7AKKm_-b-W_zKfzC5NrQQ.text: I was surprised how quickly we were seated, Saturday night had people out the door. It was our first time to this location and the food was good but the bean dip was not seasoned well that day. The salsa is always too hot for me, but they always accommodate with the green salsa for chip dipping. The best part of this location is the view! We got lucky and got a table near the window. Born and raised in Vegas and the view never gets old.

EXVoMCIyhFhsfiPsPD6VDA.text: Try to be seated by the window, because of the view. The view you get of Las Vegas is spectacular.  Service was excellent. Starting with host to the waiters everyone was very nice and friendly.  I had the chicken enchiladas was a little disappointed because the chicken didn't have much of a taste. I love some spiciness to my good.  I have to say the guacamole was excellent the waiter made it in front of us. Delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

YuDAuzmjU2LgRNjKywp6Dg.text: I have waited 6 days to write a review as I wanted it to be objective and not emotional. I was invited to a party here.   The booking was for 25 people at 7pm. Those of us that arrived at 7pm were sat at a table with the Party Girl. As people arrived, it was clear there was no seating for them. The restaurant had sat us at a wrong table that wasn't large enough.   I offered to move as I am a work colleague and not family. I was squished in a small booth with 4 other people. We were given a plate of beans, some salsa and some chips and a few utensils. So now we are not on the main table, that's ok, the girls are fun.  I asked for water as soon as we sat down. It didn't come.   We were then moved to a table that was added on to the original table. I sat down, asked for water and they set the places. I had no mat and no fork. I asked for water again, it still didn't come.   Everyone was given a soup bowl apart from me. I ordered fajitas and when they came, had to find a fork to eat them with. I asked for water again and got a glass. I chose to eat the fajitas off of the skillet and leave the sides to take home to Larry.   I asked for another glass of water, it never came.   When the waiter came to clear my plate, I said to him I needed a box for the sides. He said 'are you finished?' And pointed to the skillet. I said yes but need a box for the sides. He picked up the sides and put them on a dirty plate. When I told him no, I want a box to take them home, he scolded me and said in a huff 'you said you was finished', I said yes I am but I made it clear from the off, I needed a box. I still didn't get a refill on the water.   So in summary, I sat at three different place settings, had two glasses of water in two hours, didn't have a place mat or fork, didn't get soup and got told off by the waiter at the end of the meal.   No, I would not recommend this restaurant.

7bUZZI0vVSLXrbuEp7HloQ.text: I've been to Lindo Michoacan on desert inn so many times since it had been just a hole in the wall restaurant. So I give this place 5 stars based on the food and the ambiance on its own.   However, my mom called this place to ask for the wait time and asked in Spanish. The woman said hold on a minute and then left my mom on the phone for 7 minutes - we could hear the background noise of the restaurant the entire time. I decided to call again and the same lady answered me (based on the sound of her voice) and when I asked her what the wait time was she answered me right then and there.   I could understand if she didn't speak Spanish so was unable to answer my mom, BUT in a Mexican restaurant it would not have taken her 7 minutes to find someone who did speak Spanish. I just thought it was disrespectful.

Qi3buChv-oECZcewumKWpg.text: I have no idea why this place has anything less then 5 stars..... The service is always amazing ! The food is amazing ! And they make they're own tortillas fresh by the entrance where you can watch while you wait, If there's even a wait. The view is amazing also ! After a year of living in Las Vegas this has stayed my favorite authentic Mexican restaurant and probably always will! Love you Lindo Michoacan !

Abv0ANsAQQJzLQVfnEtZAw.text: We've been here many times & it's always great food & great atmosphere. They are always busy on evenings & weekends, but u can make a reservation or do call ahead. ALL of the employees here are always friendly & polite & working super hard to get u seated & fed asap. There is a talented gentleman who sings & plays guitar on weekends, idk if he's there all the time, but I love hearing him. They also have an awesome view of vegas from the bar & the balcony room w/ all the big windows. I usually get veggie fajitas, the only thing I would change is less veggies, MORE guacamole! It's just too many veggies for a meal, I always take home a box. They have salsa roja & salsa verde, both are delicious, my husband likes to mix them together. They also bring out fideo soup before your meal. You will never leave this place hungry that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie Fajita

Ko1DA4BPmBaMDoACozQhww.text: We eat here 2 or 3 times a month. The food is always great from the burritos to the enchiladas and the steaks always fresh and flavors are on point. The servers helpers are quick in getting you chips beans,salsa and drinks. I will continue to eat here because we love the food and atmosphere. The one small complement I have is sometimes the servers are not at the top of there game. That is the only reason I did not give a 5 star rating. But I recommend if your looking for great Mexican food good drinks this place is it.

7_XyE2LuW9qWLOFS2kscrA.text: I love Lindo Michoacan. We go every time I'm in town visiting my friends and family who live nearby. The only problem is that there's too much good food between the bean dip, fideo soup, and tableside guacamole, that I am stuffed when I'm only a third of the way through my main course. But that's what leftovers are for. I also love the live music, and the views are fabulous! Definitely a great, fun meal!

au2-cDvDcoUEb7o3GEKKxA.text: Wow!!!  Call me impressed.  Been looking for a great authentic Mexican restaurant in Vegas for years now.  A nail tech told us about this place and after reading reviews we thought "okay" we'll try it.   The view is unbelievable, the margaritas were amazing and food was perfect.   I strayed from normal lunch order which a tostada and tried the Carnitas which I'm super picky about. They did disappoint.  Crispy, tasty and served hot.  I normally would order corn tortillas but was told their flour ones were "homemade" so I tried them. OMG the best.  Perfect     They bring great chips and salsa and bean dip to start. So good and the view. This place is great and I will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Almost gone margarita
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fideo included with every order
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. View

kZQsk_-Uap4VYnqux_5hsQ.text: Went here while in Vegas at the suggestion of our Uber driver.  Great suggestion!! When you go in ask for a table with a view so that you see the strip! I love that they serve bean dip with your chips and salsa. It had a great flavor and the salsa had a roasted taste which was a nice change.   I got the chipotle cessation salad which was really tasty. The best part of it was the cornbread they served with it. It was moist, sweet, and slightly charred from the pan they cook it in. Really pleased we went there!

KTHmnsJprAgJf_JyEKsLSg.text: Great food with an amazing view of the strip! Sit next to the window and enjoy some chips with guacamole as you watch the beautiful view. The food is delicious and we had great service from Cesar, always making sure our drinks were refilled. Table side guacamole was prepared so nicely! The taco salad from the lunch menu was excellent! Try the pina drink as well! Honestly everything was spectacular. My uncle brought us here as he lives here but it's a great place to eat at as you visit! Kids menu has a good selection! The dessert is to die for!!!! Deep fried ice cream! Overall no complains!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Beautiful view of the strip

tDRkrltlzOSipYYt7ClIcQ.text: I have my favorite dishes here and can assure you that the menu is vast and there's something for everyone. If you desire breakfast I can recommend the Huevos Divorciado with fried eggs with a green sauce on one and a red sauce on the other with beans, rice & tortillas. I always love their freshly made tortillas, corn or flour. Lunch for me is always a toss up between Pollo con rajas e crema (chicken with poblanos in a cream sauce) or the Chili Rellenos. My not giving a fifth star is largely attributable to the chicken dishes which are made with chicken breast having been very tough & chewy the last few visits. They have a full house here at lunch and dinner times so I've learned to come at off times to avoid the rush. Service is typically attentive and friendly, we come here often, especially for birthdays since they make it so fun with a shot of tequila and a sombrero!  We have on occasion found some of the waitstaff to be a bit surly but if I can, I always request our favorite server, Octavio. He's kind & always considerate of our special needs girl in a wheelchair. Yesterday we met a new busboy there that was very sweet, named Walfer (yea not a typo). It's noisy and has a high energy most of the time & has great views.  I don't think it will disappoint, especially if you begin with a Margherita & table side guacamo

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Octavio our favorite server
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Views from dining area

JpeTEzzuuiYzXeVLwcpANw.text: Delicious food with great ambiance !! I loved how they make the guacemole right in front of you , would love to go back there

i9afjTLlVrTzMQu9m0-KYg.text: It's always a pleasure coming here. I could go on and on about the food here and tell you all about it. But it would be kind of pointless because everything is good here, I come here at least once a week. But I will tell you that if you are coming here you should definitely get the tableside guacamole. It is hands-down the best thing to start a meal with!

rJWzZMOyA2P-qC3rFZEShw.text: Terrible, lousy! Ate there one Sunday with my dtr-n-law, sister and grands. Buffet style worst food I Ever tasted. Gave it a second chance (2017) for my friend's birthday, (her choice, not mine.) I spent $78.00. The food Was Still Lousy! Don't waste ur time or money...unless u can't cook and anything tastes good to u!

aE1xe90D6o4GJn8dU6iJpg.text: This was my first time at this location. It looked great inside. This has the makings of a good experience. But turned out to be very dull. Our servers were less then enthusiastic. None of them had smiles on their faces. Our main server seemed kind of rude. We had about four servers. It took about five minutes for my eyes to adjust to the dim lighting to read the menu. I used the lighting from the bright window to see the menu. It was funny because I noticed two others doing the same thing.  The lunch menu offerings were standard. Nothing spectacular. There were no stand out offerings that we had ordered. The chips and salsa were bland. The fresh guacamole we ordered was made so carelessly and quickly with this "lets get this over with attitude." Our server over-salted it. Big time. It was inedible. It was a disappointing lunch experience as we brought our friend from Belgium here to sample the authentic food. We will never return to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

PhQsBWLqXsgJGZvOEFyUBw.text: We decided to celebrate a friend's birthday here the other night and it was my first time ever dining here. We actually went on a Monday afternoon, which was during happy hour and offering some good prices on lunch specials as well.  (+) Those happy hour specials were good! We were enjoying Dos Equis and Corona drafts for $3 each! They are known for their margaritas and have a ton of other drink options at good prices! (+) Lunch specials offered a lot of options at very good prices! (From $8.95 to $12.95) (+) Service was very good and attentive. We started out as 3 and then turned into a group of 5. We were checked on repeatedly by multiple employees. It was fantastic! I never felt like I had to wait a long time to request something or ask a question. (+) free chips with salsa an dip. refilled often and without requesting it. This was a great feature too! (+) the view of the strip from behind the bar looked cool af. I bet it looks great at night!  (-) As great as all that is, the food is honestly average at best. I really, really wanted to love this place but the food just kills it. It wasn't horrible, by any means. It was just very underwhelming. It was about on the level with Hotel Casino EDR food. Nothing I would ever crave to eat again. lol  which is a shame.   I may just come back one day because the service was outstanding, the atmosphere IS fun, and the drink specials are pretty good. I will just have much more tempered expectations when it comes to the food.  3 stars.  It is A-Ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. View
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. #33 Carne Asada plate/ lunch special $12.99

xK4CG1q_ihYaTvCxZ01kXg.text: Food is ok. Not really the flavorful mexican food your thinking of more like a bland taco bell. place is hella loud ! between the band and the birthday singing you will have a hard time holding a conversation with your table. The views are nice, the soup was bomb but that was about it. Don't think I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

TkA95Nx8UUmKuha3pgIUsw.text: We stopped here for lunch as we visited family. The place was busy and has a nice view of Las Vegas. We did score a table with a view.  3 of us had margaritas and they ok, not the best but good. The chips and salsa were very good.  We shared the "ocho" lunch special, it comes with fideo soup, rice and beans. Very good sauce.  Homemade corn tortillas.

oFKAOrOVIoZIBWgnbZvE0w.text: The chips were a little thin and didn't had no salt. The salsa was a little too "hot" spicy but it was good when you mix it with the fried beans. We also ordered the shrimp and avocado dish that was really tasty even though need it more lime flavor and some more cilantro. The taco salad that my husband ordered was not good, he was actually expecting the ground meat and instead he got shredded meat.. I ordered the chicken chimichanga the rice and the fried beans were good but the chimichanga was over cooked and didn't had no sauce. The staff were very in fact I really like that when they serve the food they use have glove. I wish all the restaurant would do that. And yes I will go back again just because I would like to try another meal...

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

mo3uO7eZb8AcV5vH1lmAKQ.text: I highly recommend this restaurant. Excellent food and great customer service here. I plan on returning very soon.

nO_8VPh0Wi_D_rUTDxUm4A.text: Food was excellent. Service was even better.  We got a great seat with a beautiful view of the city lights.

mETVXDYif2W-mJ3FBBZ-YQ.text: I love going to Lindo Michoacan not just for the food but for the best view! Food is good, service is always on par and they are always good at keeping the margaritas flowing!   Prices are reasonable because you do get a lot of food. Most of the time you can share with another person and still have left overs!

cIVlLzkZLhGrrSr6xWjfEQ.text: I've been here several times and the food is, at best, mediocre! But today the service was horrible. We were a party of 4 and the waiter only took 2 drink orders and walked away. The rest of us were shocked that he didn't finish taking everyone's drink request and when we called him over to tell him, he completely dismissed us. Will not be coming back here again.

Fjy-JdICzSbKzSY_bFG_hw.text: The food and atmosphere had me like I was in the heart of Mexico. Guacamole made at the table, bean dip and spicy salsa and chips. A truly unique and authentic Mexican restaurant.

cKwYQJu0tzr6ZY4JAOKdnA.text: I like this place. Huge menu, great hours, great view, nice staff. The food is not mind blowing but it is tasty! The selection is the best part, if you like Mexican food you will find something you like here. They've got like 5 different dishes with lengua which is awesome. Not a bad beer selection, and the margaritas are pretty good also. All around a great spot, and definitely a place in our standard rotation!

X_REzJZqEhi4GoxwwVqDqQ.text: Very tasty Mexican food. The view at the Lindo is amazing! Best place to go for a girls night, date night or special occasion especially if you call ahead for a table near a window for night or even day time views of the Vegas valley!  The menu has many delicious items, the fish tacos, the pollo azado burrito, the spicy pork carnitas(food network) and the table side guacamole.  The Cadillac margarita is delicious!!!! The dessert of the fried ice cream is amazing but when ordering make sure you ask for the flameado! That's the best dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. The food network featured spicy carnitas!!!

ypak5GNRiR-WRLNcf2WDDg.text: I found this to be a very authentic Mexican restaurant, with a very lovely atmosphere.  The waiters and waitresses were 100% on the ball.  Look at the photos of my drink, never went more than half full.  Chips and salsa were always full too.  Plenty of food and it was the real deal as far as the food goes.  Would definitely come back again.  When it comes to service, food, and taste this restaurant scored the 5/5 which is why I will come back.  The only small drawback was the loud music.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried ice cream!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. By far best service I&#39;ve had in a restaurant when it comes to refills on drinks!  My glass never went more than half empty.
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Ordered flautas, absolutely delicious!

EfF6J25s0voms9I_exTApA.text: The view and the architecture of this place is outstanding. You can see the strip and the whole valley. However, it's very, very loud, the food is average, lots of obnoxious drunks and the customer service, while efficient, has no smiles and lacks that friendly quality, everybody looks stressed. I probably won't go back.

-e_nIduwC3n11EY5p8SkFw.text: I love this place.  Great food, great atmosphere, and good prices for the incredible view of the strip.  All the shrimp dishes are delish.  Try either the beef or pork with Coca-Cola sauce, if you are Coke fan.  Parking is a pain during prime hours, but that is only because this place is so popular.  You will always eventually find a parking spot, there just might be a little bit of walk to the restaurant.  Once you get inside, you will realize it was worth the distractions.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican Bulldog- half margarita, half corona.
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fillet Relleno-orange roughy with shrimp...yum

nYINfx9zc-Ox1aFW3_b5kA.text: I can't believe that I didn't update this review!  I am NEVER EVER going back to Lindo Michoacan.  You couldn't drag me there if my life depended on it.  We had such a wonderful meal our 1st time there.  Not so much for the 2nd time.  Once again, I had one of their signature chicken dishes (can't remember the name) and a preparada.  This time I was violently ill for 2 days afterwards.  I'm not sure what gave me the food poisoning, but it was horrible.  Could've just been a fluke, but trust me, I am not going back to find out!

1epdnfDIo-EjBq-lTNsBFA.text: I've been here twice. Delicious food in a beautiful setting & fine service, plus big windows for a view of Las Vegas.

BniOSzJJ4gS7TZL6Jy0w0A.text: Mediocre,  and unauthentic Mexican food,  yellow cheese on everything. They fill you up with rice and beans. It's more like  taco bell served with silverware. The seafood served is not fresh and the classic Mexican dishes like the moles are run of the mill.  They all lack flavor.   Long list of different types of margaritas but no matter which one you order they're all exactly the same. Yet you pay a premium for the tequila in it.    Yet this place is super crowded,  it must be the view. They have the best view of any restaurant in Las Vegas. That is why I give them two stars,  well deserved.

O4grhss39VJYjWLWg4_6fQ.text: I have eaten here quite a few times since it opened, and I have to say they have a great view and a great Margarita.  The chips and bean dip are very good (hard not to fill up on them, in fact).  They have some atypical items on the menu, which is always nice. My daughter is a big fan of the unusual items (goat, tongue, etc.) whereas I stick with a more traditional line (Carnitas, Chile Rellenos).  While the food is good and plentiful, it could be a bit spicier and a bit more imaginative. The Rellenos need more cheese and less batter.  Does every dish have to come with beans and rice?  (Admittedly, their beans and rice are better than most.)  My biggest complaint with most Mexican food in Vegas (and this applies to Chinese food here most of the time, too) is that it's too bland.  Spice is life, people!!!  ;D

y0AlPDzwSP5W_aQTcCLBkA.text: How can you not love this place? Awesome chips and salsa, vegan beans for dipping (on request) and TONS of veggie options on the menu in addition to all the meat eater plates. This is definitely a restaurant with something for everyone and we always bring new guests to vegas here.

8rtYPROzBfHHyQxfEFYQtg.text: Amazing food! Shrimp tacos were fresh and hot. Serving size was plentiful. Our first server was quite slow, despite being seated at the bar top. Our second bartender paid much more attention to us and was a delight. We thoroughly enjoyed our food and will definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas.

yHZVV6j6sGylXmntMzz3Kg.text: Fantastic, I have tried all the locations always the best service ... Great View of the City from the one in Henderson

ScpwexOr7mGQ2TsqIb57Jw.text: One of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. They bring shame and dishonor to mexico

m6EzOQeSR1Yi_qVGdit5jQ.text: Amazing carne asada burrito! Definitely going back many times.

MheK7TW0sEAhLNSbQKf4Ww.text: Went in for lunch and the food was really good. Great service, our waiter made some recommendations that fit perfectly with our meal. The view is amazing.

RwU2u012wHex45sLQg77Zg.text: I love Mexican food and this place is one of the best Mexican restaurants in town.  They have a huge selection of amazing dishes. Just reading the menu items description will have you salivating. I love the Steak Ranchero. Its a new york steak sitting in red and green sauce smothered in cheese.   Great view of the city and very authentic Mexican feel. The staff are so on top of things

h0VZZ45658U7bgh1sP4bmg.text: The food was great and the price was good.  The only few things we disliked here was that there is too much going on and our waiter didn't come once to see how things were, or we needed anything more (which we did), he came at the end of our meal to offer dessert and the check.   We were trying to get his attention but he was too strung out.  So this is what we didn't like, one who puts children near speakers? (children need to be placed away from the DJ and speakers)  The greeters need a little more training on that, a fail on management.  Another fail, from management is the singing of the Happy Birthday to guest. Great idea, but don't take the waiters / waitresses away from their tables.  Keep the help, the food runners, waiters & waitresses doing their job and create another job for other positions there that don't have that big of an impact to your operations.  Such as, your three overwhelming greeters, use two to sing and alternate them as needed. Use the manager walking around as the other singer and that singing DJ too.  Now, you have a team of singers who won't impact your operations as you did before.  The last thing that was just as annoying as everything else failing here was that darn cow .  Are we at the NFR? This is crazy, employees were even cringing when they had to hit it.  It was just too much.  Why at the restaurant? In the middle of the dinning room, what? Good food but the environment needs to be controlled.

4cYOIo7kN-ruCd1tJ7wKyg.text: Have eaten here several times. The food is always good and the view of the strip is amazing. Can't go wrong with Mexican food and margaritas. So good.

0peNjesXXsNV0kGrOSvd9Q.text: I had lunch today  food was good! Great view!! They had lunch specials! Dont forget to order guacamole and chips for appetizer because they make it fresh right in front of you! Who does not like fresh guacamole! They also served chips,beans, and red salsa to start.  I ordered chicken and shrimp fajitas and chicken enchiladas.  Another cool thing I noticed someone was celebrating a birthday and they bring these big hat and put it on the birthday celebrant and the servers sing birthday song!! Customer service is good  and price is reasonable for lunch specials! Yes  I would recommend this place.

zsEt5IVCh6DDa9459BoY6g.text: Love the food and also the area.   This place is the shit. Love that they leave you alone to actually eat.  This place is always busy and I understand why.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

QUUYDjvLbiiTfrdI7C_frA.text: In addition to the food being terrible, the service was awful. The worst I've experienced in a long time. Neither the bus staff nor the waiters ever gave eye contact. They rushed through taking our order and didn't answer any questions we asked. The wait stood at one end of the table to take orders and didn't walk closer as he took other orders. We were a party of 7 at a large table. My parents (late 70's) were at the far end and couldn't here him. He only moved closer when I asked him to do so. When poring coffee, the waiter reached across me to pour a cup for the person next to me. They also never came back to fill our drinks until we flagged them down. No one was friendly or ever smiled. Not a great Sunday meal with the family.

ZLkOqhvB7gn4uW97_dFiwA.text: I love this restaurant! The staff is great. The food is amazing. I love the guacamole appetizer. They make it table side just the way you like it. The margaritas are the best in town. This is the best place in Vegas for Mexican food!

ZSX-b-8C4r_6XNODu_BgZw.text: El Lindo is one of our favorite spots in Las Vegas (Henderson, I know).  Spectacular views of the city, great bean dip and chips, amazing service (these guys work hard for the money), fun atmosphere and of course, really delicious entrees.  If you go on the weekend they'll have a single musician jamming out hard on guitar or some keys and singing/playing along with some pre-recorded tracks. These guys are INTO it, so just sit back and enjoy them enjoying themselves.  Food-wise, I've had a lot of different items and they have all been good. Probably not the absolute greatest food I've ever had, but it's quite tasty and the prices are very reasonable.  As a whole package, this is one of our go-to spots and we always bring our out of towners here and they rave about it. Being on top of seemingly the largest hill in Henderson makes it a cool experience, so try to get a window seat and make sure to hang over the railing for a bit before you head off for the evening.

GqFIiodfb-rdc2FL9BCk9A.text: We decided to go there yesterday after reading all the reviews and since we have never been there. We went there at 6 pm and were told that we would have a 15-20 min wait. We were OK with it. So we waited and waited. Our party had to wait for 35-40 min before we got our table. It was really frustating. After getting our table, our experience with the food was not any better. It took us around 45 min to get our food from the time we ordered and we just nibbled on the chips and salsa. No one came to ask if we needed more salsa or bean dip (our bean dip was empty). The chips were not freshly fried (not warm). Anyway, the food was just OK. I would not pay the price to go and eat there again. The food was just OK. The rice and beans tasted like out of a can. The only good thing about this place is the view of the strip.  Really wanted to like it, came home very disappointed.

hbl71X62Zx9PlCdud8pEew.text: Great view, pretty good food, we left very full and happy :). My bf got the grilled shrimp with garlic and I had the fish soup. I was very pleased with the amount of seafood in my soup. The fideo is always yummy and I love their salsa. Very good place, we will be back.

9fM2uD27mHTDJBjljgoFvQ.text: I love this restaurant-the food is good, the atmosphere is fun and lively, plus they have an amazing view of the city!  Their fideo soup is delicious!  Their sopitas, enchiladas and fajitas are all great too!

pSuKzn8_y4-M8EzXpsvHug.text: Had the Fish Tacos for Lunch. Grilled perfectly and alot of fish in each of the 3 tacos. Not much room for the cabbage that came on the side but they didn't even need it. Very good, will return!

MwpWZel9ZZVpgBl6BLPDSQ.text: This place is good. The service was great. Our food came out really really fast! If you can get a table by the window the view is cool, you can see the LV sky line! Best part was the Cadillac Margaritas they are strong. Not weak you can definitely taste the alcohol in it!! The food was good definitely worth checking out! Loud atmosphere good for kids and birthday dinners!!!

LPv-UckZO0KjXzFpuJ_djA.text: You can't beat the city views from this place. The food is pretty good, but way better at the original location! It's a bit loud, especially with all the birthday celebrations going on.

MczRYwDECIHtr6TK9RM1YA.text: Parking was absolutely atrocious,  had to park forever far away and walk. I ordered a shrimp dish and the shrimp was badly over cooked. I had to send it back for the chile verde, which was delicious. Margaritas were great. I think the prices are high for the quality. Nice bathrooms and great service though!

Wuo6JoDPnDFnzaRFQHyEsw.text: Four of us had dinner on 2/15.  Everything started out fantastic, excellent view great appetizers.  Had 2 chicken burrito's with red sauce, one chicken enchilada and one chili verde burrito. Three of us who ate the burrito's ended up sick for a week.  Not sure if left overs from the Valentine's Day crowd.  I read the reviews but not likely to return or if we do will partake in drinks and appetizers only.

VsxeNY0Tq9moTeORfeh4Pg.text: The food is good really filling !! Usually when we end our Vegas trip we have breakfast here it's not too bad great drinks!

G-vBPekQS7rxqx4HiE-xyw.text: We travel from SCAL to Vegas often and NEVER miss an opportunity to visit this restaurant. With all the excellent Mexican offered in Cali, this particular restaurant tops them all. Service is 1st class, seafood prepared to its finest, soups always delicious, combination plates never disappoint and dessert always a treat. We love the wait staff and had the pleasure of meeting the owner Javier. It's been 5 years now and I can't say there's ever been one bad experience here at the Henderson location. Did I mention the view is the best view I've seen in a restaurant in the Vegas area? Try this place and rate it yourself! #BestInVegas2004-2005,2006-2007,2008-2009,2011-2012,2013LasVegasReviewJournalPoll

72OhMUJBgw3S3ir_6hv42w.text: AMAZING food!!! We cant wait to go back!!!! The atmosphere was fantasic and the salsa and bean dip........soooooooooo good!!!

G87uIKCWF25h8IwLZuLMwA.text: I always love coming here. The atmosphere is awesome.. the food is SO GOOD! its a little pricey but its completely worth it!! The live music is fun and the birthday celebrations are fun too.

hk9rdJjdShKdS2aPIZrjPg.text: I really don't understand why people rave about this place. The view is amazing but the food is not really that good. It's okay at best. I've eaten here several times, tried different things and still cannot find anything I like. Service can be good but last time I had to wait 20 minutes for my waiter to come back to the table to ask for more salad dressing.

A3VB12pr0D_t4dInwXRDag.text: Our first time in Vegas. We get invited to this place to go have dinner. About 30 of us there so we were at one long table and one big round booth. Getting in there was tough because I had a stroller with my 9 month and EVERY server kept walking in my way instead of letting me take a seat they kept doing their thing until the manager yelled and waved for them to move. Everything was fine until the servers kept bumping into me and my son without with saying I'm sorry excuse me NOTHING out of the 9 times I got bumped into to 2 were apologized. The food was OKAY the beans and rice were cold but my enchiladas were good! Most of our orders were wrong but I'm glad I got Emily to take my order she got it right! When they started picking up plates etc they just grabbed the stuff without even asking without saying excuse me are you done with that or excuse me let me clear that up for you nothing! Before I forget I ordered a drink from Emily I got the drink within the next 1-2 mins Luis brings it out he's standing between a co-worker and I and he's asking who order the drink I'm wave to him I did! I repeated my self 3 times and called his name 2 times and still didn't notice I said the soda was mine until a serve called his name and looked my way I was so fed up after that. Would I return NO!

OTRVFXFuXCE8wxYzbUH29g.text: Waitress first day on the job.  Can"t speak english.  Doesn"t understand me.  Food is ok. View is great.  Sign says max play gets you free drink.  What it means is $20.  So they can't even write what they mean.  This place belongs in Mexico.  Sorry but this is USA.  I ask for lunch chili Verde I get tagged dinner and am charged for it.  Terrible, don't go here.

FYL51t73pcmDk8YwUG6wSw.text: Service was wonderful! Margaritas are awesome. Salsa is ok.... My husband got a pork dish and it was yummy. Cooked perfectly. I got the shrimp chimichanga and it was horrible. Shirmp was wayyy over cooked and the pico filling was gross. I'm willing to give the place another chance.

nGCoypf1stWgiRWemS2UVg.text: Lindo - on DI used to be a great place.  But it seems like the secret got out, the business grew and quality suffered.  It kind of reminds me of going to a large chain style Mexican Restaurant in Southern Cal.  If that's your thing - this place is for you.  I leave here feeling like I have consumed 100lbs of salt, it's very loud and parking is tough.  But it does have the best view in town.

l3dvK6Ddh4dtQMTxX-3CMw.text: Ngah. I wish the food was as good as the view. If you enjoy alcohol with your meal, you'll probably get tipsy enough to gloss over how mediocre the food is. And if you're fine with sloshing hot sauce on the main dish then you're probably not very picky about whether the meat tastes gamey or the tortillas greasy. Maybe we got unlucky, or maybe we ordered the wrong things, but I ate at the DI location about a decade ago and remember it tasting equally disappointing.  Servers were friendly and helpful, even while comping half of our meal; chips and bean dip were above average, but so too were all the prices. Water was clean tasting if you care about that sort of thing. View is fantastic. And I really disliked the food.  We would love to find just one meal here that works for our cursed picky-eater super-taster palates, so we'd have an excuse to come by and enjoy the view and friendly service. Who knows what it'll take to come back, though.

fEYWbppFtZOH2fBVzF2LGw.text: This is a beautiful restaurant with Amazing Mexican food.!  The original is nice but doesn't even compare to this location.

l0vb_zOaM6XjdX0qMK-Igw.text: The food was delicious!! We had the Carne asada plate and shrimp chilled rellenos. The Chile was a little under cooked for my liking. We also had menudo which was good. Hand made tortillas are a must. I love that they give you beans with salsa with your chips. But be careful you might get full with them. A definite must next time we're in Vegas again.

aibttPEpUNtQ1RogGSMWHg.text: We have been here several times and it keeps getting progressively worse.  The view is amazing and the service has always been short but attentive.  The food however is not worthy.  Tonight our fajitas were terrible.  Absolutely, bland with no seasoning at all.  The presentation was bad too.  Looked  like canned dog food.  Fajitas are such a simple dish to make delicious with a little thought and care.  As well as my daughters enchilada was cold when it hit the table.  I think the kitchen needs to be retrained and management needs to slow everything down, so people can relax enjoy themselves and hopefully enjoy some good Mexican fair.  Instead of having that turn and burn mentality.

lJTP6nTEQOf6pJ2PiXbANg.text: My friends call me a child, but I can't help but order a cheese enchilada. Add rice and beans and you have a mess of cheese greatness mixing it together like your mom tells you in not playing with your food. Add the table side guac, live music, and a view of the city and you create a Mexican food masterpiece.

qTpUdEfJDIdqQepqWOauTw.text: Out of all of the Michoacan-themed restaurants around the valley, I go to the La Loma Lindo location the most often since I live in Henderson. It's a solid bet when I feel like having some super delicious chicken -- I've had every chicken dish on their menu and found you can't go wrong with any of them. My favorites are the gallo al mojo de ajo, pollo sarandeado, and pollo al tomate. I'm a sauce fanatic, and the sauce on all three of these dishes is to die for! The carnitas are also pretty super, and tender enough to fall apart at the touch of your fork. The portions are enormous on almost all of these dishes -- every time, I can pretty much get 3 meals out of whatever I order, making it a fantastic deal for a moderately-priced restaurant.  Other things I like about this Lindo are the ease of getting a table (I've never made reservations and have never had to wait more than 10-15 mins for a table, even when they're super packed); all of the choices of margaritas (their skinny margarita is actually the closest most places come to offering an actual "real"/classic margarita); and the view, which is especially awesome after sunset. Service is also pretty decent and super quick most of the times I've gone. Also, if you call in a to-go order, they'll actually also give you the cup of fideo soup AND the beans/salsa and chips they'd give you if you were actually dining there, which most places definitely wouldn't do if you were ordering take-out.   Drawbacks are the noise (this location gets really loud to begin with, acoustically, but then one of the dudes playing keyboard & singing comes on and you can't even hear yourself think, much less hear your dinner companion speaking) and the beef dishes (I've tried a couple, and both times the meat was tough & not very flavorful, in spite of the other flavorful ingredients).  If you're in Henderson and you're looking for flavorful Mexican food that deviates from the standard burrito/taco/quesadilla offerings, you shouldn't be disappointed with this place.

mp0yoFTgOoB_QUw6ZEc-LA.text: For authentic Mexican food in the desert, Lindo Michoacan is great.  The food taste amazing, the salsa is spicy, the margarita's are strong and the portions are large.  The service is also very wonderful.  I had the carnitas on the bone and it was fall off the bone moist and succulent.  The burrito is also super huge and can be enjoyed by 2 people!   We also had the Queso Fundedo con Choritzo for the app.  It was not the best I've ever had.  I would pass the next time.  When My wife was sick, I came her to get the Pollo soup and it was fabulous, hit the spot.    The only downfall is that is quite expensive for Mexican food.  Our dinner bill was around $80 (1 drink).  I always feel like Asian food and Mexican food should not be that expensive.   My humble opinon.  Other than that, if you are looking for great Mexican food, I'd recommend.

U7zG1UixK9j6GtgewvmjVw.text: Great food and the views of the city are amazing!! Family members brought me here for my birthday and I thought I may escape the singing but not quite. Free tequila shot if the sing and you wear the hat!!!

490xQ5S0WsLUx-hlRRinmg.text: Food was okay, but nothing to rave about. View is great, but they don't offer a window seat even if there are several available.

VIro1TxfAqVprzSjQZ0whQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots for Mexican food.  The service is always excellent and speedy.  This location has a great view of the strip too if your into that sort of thing (just kidding, I'm not heartless)  They usually have some kind of live music or performers playing during the evening so just be prepared for the noise factor.  There may be a wait but it moves pretty fast and it's worth it!  We miss Tex-Mex flavors and now that we've found Lindo we have a place to cure the hankerin!

VRkBE-N_0f0PvSbHvDAAtA.text: This Mexican is impressed by their menu, Cadillac margarita, panoramic view, and overall aesthetics.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Strong and delicious Cadillac Margarita, beautiful view, and Poker. Winning!

vK0y4XzXBv8lTPmcSHxCIQ.text: We came here for the first time last weekend.  The chips & salsa & beans are sooo good (a little too good because I filled up on those) as well as the margaritas.  We came early so we got happy hour pricing (even better) and the views were amazing.  We were so impressed we are going to have our rehearsal dinner here for our wedding!  The staff is really friendly and the atmosphere is wonderful. Can't wait to come back!

A4sJ1dGQfwNJ2A71oTBLCw.text: Views are spectacular! Love the decor and size of the restaurant would be amazing in the evening to look out over the valley. The food was okay to good certainly not the best Mexican food I have ever had but good. I would go back to try some drinks I was there in the middle of the day on business :( so no margaritas this time. While we were there there was a mariachi band that was way way way way too loud, we literally could not hear each other over the table but I am thinking that it was a special occasion and hopefully not the norm.

pHHtZmkldbU9llF4gQvXfQ.text: I visited Vegas last June, and my daughter took my wife and I to eat at this restaurant.  AMAZING food!  Not only is the food amazingly tastie, but the view is fantastic.  We loved the hand-made tortillas. We will definitely return.

D10eZGKBMeY7xE-N2p02PA.text: Had a really nice time. Great location. Packed!!! But the wait wasn't too long.  They come around to the table often to check and make sure all is well. The 'only' thing that could get better  in my opinion is the parking. Besides that this place is awesome.

zarviOR76qRYymC_b31ufg.text: Delicious micheladas. Chips with  warm beans and salsa. The waiters are very nice.  Awsome place ans great view. VIVAAAAA Las vegas!!!

_sSKIZ8OuqYnmBspPiinjg.text: Really good food at reasonable prices. Huge portions and a very attentive wait staff.  We didn't have reservations, but were seated within just a few minutes (on a Friday night).  We got there moments before the dinner crowd swarmed through the front door.  Another plus is they don't water down their margaritas like most other places do.  I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 solely because of the off-key singer in the live entertainment.

m7LArJnA2UlrhI_qjzwDHw.text: The view is awesome either during the day or night. It's a panoramic view of Las Vegas from Henderson. The food is above average, but the guacamole was dynamite. They make it right at the table with fresh ingredients. My favorite is the fish tacos but the beef ranchero wasn't bad. You can always find a 15% off coupon. Great people and great service.

2CR7H3wCPUKJ-e-mnuReBw.text: The staff was super attentive. Food was yummy...more tex-mex like. The view was awesome! You could see the whole valley. I went for lunch with my family and it was pretty quiet compared to the weekend (according to my Mom), but it was a Wednesday afternoon and we were looking for something good! It really seems like it would be a fun nighttime bar/food spot....I'll definitely visit when I'm in town again! BTW the margaritas looked awesome....alas I didn't try one.

2PtJENlVZB1izcjcvI6ynQ.text: I've been here several times as well as the one in Vegas. The staff is always great, the food decent (the guacamole and bean dip is great!), and their margaritas are perfect! Whenever we are in Vegas we always go eat here because its that good!!

XWScl60w7-U8tgAxXiveHw.text: Love the food, and they have the best strawberry margaritas in the valley! But, the last two times my husband and I have made reservations we still ended up waiting 20 plus minutes to be seated which is super annoying. The whole point of making a reservation ahead is to not have to wait. The front host staff and their customer service could use some work! I was pretty annoyed having to wait with a scheduled reservation and they were not apologetic at all, after 15 minutes I asked for an update and one of the girls (didn't catch her name but she had very long dark hair) rolled her eyes at me and seemed bothered I was asking. They seem super unorganized. Also, the parking is a pain. You almost always have to wait for a spot because there is maybe 20 spots max in their lot and the restaurant is huge.

5cBaZaT5Fxo7hthQ4qHlgw.text: The view / atmosphere is awesome.  Depending on when you come depends on how quick you get in (duh). I've been here on days with an hour wait, but I came yesterday and was seated instantly.   Their service is stellar. Our waiter wasn't very friendly, however he was on top of his game. You're never out of chips / dip / drinks.   Decent selection of beer. Good selection of margaritas and house drinks. They're in the process of redoing their drink menu as well.  FYI their drinks are STRONG. It's not necessarily a bad thing since i'd rather have too strong of a drink than a watered down one.   Food is pretty good, kinda depends on what you order. Their speciality dishes are more expensive but taste better in my opinion; I don't really recommend their lunch specials.  Guacamole is made right in front of you and it's bomb.   I would come again for sure, however there are some competitors out there that give Lindo a run for their money

tJRHFb8ynXeoQKbwoqMcKQ.text: Pleasantly surprised they were opened until midnight on the weekends. The restaurant is perched up on a hill so a lovely view of the city went well with the friendly and welcoming staff. I was worried were coming in half an hour before closing that the staff would be weary and that the kitchen was closed, but the hostess was enthusiastic and we were seated right away. The restaurant is quite big and decorated tastefully with rustic decor without being cheesy.   Complimentary chips, salsa and bean dip came out first. It was ok. I had the carne asada nachos, fajita steak burrito, and chicken quesadilla. The chips in the carne asada nacho was a little greasy, but the meat itself was good. The portions we're big, well seasoned, not salty, and the service was attentive. This is a good place to have dinner dates or get togethers with friends and family since the city view makes a nice backdrop. I would definetly come back to try out their drinks and try their other specialities.

Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Steak fajita burrito. Huge!

ImP5H9OoWCrDJdEEMIywjA.text: My wife suggested it for lunch on Wednesday, January 24. Her suggestion was plane as day but, came out of nowhere. We requested to be seated out on the patio to enjoy the weather. Well! The food - a grilled chicken taco salad and a shrimp appetizer - was extremely tasteful. The presentation beautiful. The service Exceptional! Cost benefit positive.   Thanks for adding to a great day. See you again.

Z0_zqWa_BpXq918uhjKxHw.text: I don't know what these other reviewers are talking about...  I go to this location very often. Food is always good. Service is ALWAYS outstanding. Most of the time it's busy and you need to wait, so plan on it. Atmosphere is great.  Would definitely recommend.

eusoe3-xl_ylZm-BDHw5fQ.text: We love it here. They treat my little girl great even though she's wild, loud, and gets into mischief. The food is always good and consistent. We love the singer. He lets Emmalee sing and stand with him on stage. The place is kept clean and the view is beautiful. We come 3 times a week or more and are always treated well. The fact that isn't family friendly is why we make the drive here instead of going to other restaurants.

5g6qzb1ER0lyf8RFuSmdqw.text: I like the new location!  Ask for the green sauce for your chips.  I suggest talking to your waitstaff.  There's so many options on the menu.  The view from the window to the strip is awesome and great for date night or dinner with the family.  The mariachis are great and fun.  They do requests too!

M75cTlcjREbgT2mfSFsG6A.text: You can't beat $5 margaritas and music :) foods good to and staff is very friendly.

b9IcCMYrXtz0rkBx6WSsOA.text: Chain Mexican restaurant located in the Horizon Ridge area.  The restaurant is spacious but parking is limited and it does get crowded.  Ask to sit by the window and you will be treated to a gorgeous view of the Las Vegas Valley and strip.  The drinks are good but the margaritas are very weak.  The food menu is very large with many selections. I had my usual, the number 20 with an enchilada, chili relleno, and tamale. Delicious as always.

7JKCR6XqmLDurmKAabR2wg.text: The food was delicious. I enjoyed the customer service!! We had hector as our waiter and he was very helpful and welcoming. It was my sisters birthday and she very much enjoyed the mariachi band and food. The place was very crowded and busy so I would recommend setting a reservation in advance. We had the patio window seats and there was a gorgeous view of the strip. Overall good was great and I love the atmosphere and energy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States

FnuFcVY9dBOtDjcw58Pkag.text: do not come here if you have a big party. I always like coming here with my family of 5, so I thought we should celebrate my husband's birthday with our family from out of town visiting. I wanted to impress them with this place. I made reservations for 16. once we got there, the hostess said, it'll be just a minute as we prepare the tables together. I said ok... we wait, as my party includes 5 hungry little ones and 2 elderly...then 15 minutes go by and no one says anything to us as we watch multiple parties get seated ahead of us. we finally ask and they said they were waiting on this group to leave as they needed that table to group with the other tables they've set. another 20 minutes go by until we finally get seated. to top it off, our food didn't come out for 45 minutes! 3 of the orders were salads, and 4 were kids meals! needless to say, our relatives were not impressed and all though they liked the food and view, they said they would not like to return here. I thought the whole point to make reservations is so you didn't have to wait and the tables would already have been set for us. no one apologized for anything and not even a manager stopped by to ask how we were doing. every other time I go there with my family of 5, there's always a manager asking if everything was going well. pretty upsetting for me and unsure if I would return myself.

yhdUXwpeqQhGyBZxXhGx_Q.text: The food is decent. I had an appetizer Sopitas, nothing special. 6 sopes on a plate. I chose carne asada, Plating was a mess. Lettuce covered the entire plate. Each sopes should have been made individually, corn meal was dry . I wouldn't get that again. Wife had Chile relleno which was great. Chicken enchiladas were a bit dry. Bean dip was missing something, Needed like a lil seasoning mixed otherwise it was just refried beans with added water to make it like a dip. I will give Lindo another chance to try and redeem all the good things I've heard about them. The Fideo soup is something special. Flavor was great, tastes great. Wish that flavor influence was distributed to all their dishes..

5jaZOwcte9SwJfwc1zxFBw.text: My GF who lives in vegas brought me here because I wanted to eat Mexican food. It was a perfect recommendation as its a really spacious authentic Mexican restaurant perched on a slight incline overlooking the valley. This was close to Henderson and Green Valley.  Really large spacious restaurant with Gorgeous Views everywhere you sit. Really large expansive menu with so many items to choose from. Almost half the items I've never heard of before, it was truly authentic. This would be great for couples and large groups because it was so spacious inside.   We ordered shrimp and fish tacos and chili verde. My mom loves Chili Verde and commented it was the best she's had, large portions and the sauce was really flavourful.  The fish and shrimp tacos came with (3) each and rice and beans. It was a generous portion and exactly what I was in the mood for. Service was efficient and friendly. I saw them making Guacamole fresh tableside I'd definitely try that next time.  Great Mexican restaurant I would go again;)

8HF_MQ0FdIBI3mGtJSqfGA.text: I love this place! The food is great. Super yummy good service and viees !!! I went there on my lunch break, and they go the food in and out to us and we were done in 30 minutes. I was still able to go to work and on time. Super timely service.

Tzz1YfaVUGh8nK0jzGDPmA.text: This is an awesome restaurant with lots of great food option and great margaritas. It can be very crowded at peak times (friday or Saturday nights around 7pm) so plan accordingly. Still one of my favorite Mexican restaurants though

Ok4Z9qpmCTy_GFH3W2OZ3Q.text: Great view and good food but I marked it down for their styrofoam and plastic packaging and straws. So wasteful and inconsiderate of the environment

dmqtpkFr2tzn7G9nQrR8bg.text: I have been a customer since you came to Henderson. Through the years food has diminished in quality. Ordered my favorite Carne Assad's but the Steak was so tough I sent it back. Even the salsa is horrible. And to top it off the bathroom is disgusting! Get it together people.

yqtr13iDxd8KoGi6Br8TIQ.text: Wow! What a great restaurant.  When your in the mood for Mexican, you've got to try Lindo Michoacan.  This place is great.  They had live music, the best view of the city, great food, great service and awesome margaritas.  I was a bit nervous when we pulled up since there were about 40 cars parked on the street and the lot was full.  We went to the hostess and asked how long it would be for a table of 3 with a view?   She said we can seat you right now.  I was like OK!, let's do this...   we sat down and immediately had our drink order taken and had our food order soon after.  We got chips and salsa, followed by some amazing soups and then we all got different combo plates.  Mine was chili releno, chicken taco and a beef burrito w/beens and rice.  Everything was perfect and it came with a side of roasted jalapenos.   PERFECT

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. View of the city at sunset

9qUXw3hljzjWz6IPMSdGCw.text: Been here twice. Food is really good. Service, also really good. The temperature in the restaurant both times I was there was so hot, I could not enjoy my meal. It was 80 degrees outside and hotter in the restaurant. Unfortunately won't be back until they can afford to keep their place at a comfortable temp so i can enjoy my food.

F3QfYnrsoG-VN088cIH-Kg.text: First off, the view is incredible here.  You can see the entire valley from the windows.  So pretty at night with lights.  Called to make a reservation but was told you needed to call at least two hours ahead for such (wasn't aware of this). So name was put on a waitlist. When we got there the place was packed, and I mean packed. Our wait time was a little less in 20 minutes for a table. Overall it was OK. They serve you chips, salsa, and a really good being dip when you sit down. The bean dip was so delicious. But come to find out I think it was actually the same refried beans that were on the dish with the meal. Almost every meal came with a cup of fideo, which is basically a tomato noodle soup. It was quite tasty. I would not order the flautas again, as they were so incredibly dry. I even tried peeling off the tortilla to just eat the chicken, and I absolutely could not eat my meal. I ended up returning my meal which they ended up comping on the bill. I would definitely try it again as the others in my party enjoyed their meals. I would just pick something different to eat. Our waiter was OK, he didn't come by to check on our meals, however, the manager checked towards the end of our meal and that's who I spoke to about my dish. We sat near the bar and near a bell that they kept ringing every five or so minutes. It was quite frustrating to hear the bell go off so often and so loudly. Also because of the noise in the restaurant and the music playing everyone was yelling at each other and birthday songs were quite loud as well

Aw76qGNOzbSU6ZgROWO6QQ.text: Amazing dinner experience.  We have been here before but this time we brought a friend.  She was very impressed with the decor and view of the las vegas strip!  We ordered 3 different dishes, chicken burrito for my ex which he loved, I ordered chile relleno and it was amazing and my friend ordered a very delicate steak taco trio of some kind.  We ordered the mango cake for dessert which was really tasty.  Thanks, we will of course return!

4HI1nyqak71ZwGIoYDBr4w.text: Been here a few times and ordered out many more. First off, the location and the view! The moment you walk in, the entire valley is visible.   What's good:  The view: especially at night  Drinks: a ton options with Mexican variations Price: given the amount of food/portion size Food: fish tacos, ceviche, table side guacamole  Birthday special: you get a free shot of tequila  What's ok:  Service: hit or miss. Of the few times that I've been here, it's been mostly good but there have been times where the server forgets to place our cocktail order. Really depends on how busy they are.  The not so good:  Parking: when its packed, parking can get a little tough. Wish they offered valet on the weekends.   Overall, it's a great meal and an enjoyable experience. Worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Paloma. Pretty good.
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Fish tacos plate
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. The view at night is spectacular

LBo0fVMygsXHhl8pF5Xuug.text: We have eaten here many times and always had a great experience. Food is always fabulous, service is always on point, restaurant is always clean.  My mother loved eating here and we would take her every year for her birthday and a few other times a year. Since she died 2 years ago, my brother, my sister and I have been coming for her birthday, setting up her picture, and ordering her a Chile relleno, and a tequila shot. Of course, she never is actually there to eat with us, it's just for us to celebrate her life (cue the Coco music, no tears, only tasty adult beverages and laughing please). Tonight Manny waited on us.   Now Manny has waited on myself and my husband and my family in the past and he always a good waiter, but tonight he was stellar. He looked at her picture and told us he thought he remembered our mom (maybe he did, maybe he didn't but he made us happy to think that someone else remembered her), and he brought us the tequila, her meal, told us all to enjoy, and checked on us frequently with a big smile on his face. He even asks us if we wanted any dessert. I'm pretty sure if we were crazy enough to ask he would've had the owner singing happy birthday to an empty chair.   Manny gets a 5 star review. We love Lindo, we have always come here, and we will continue to come here. Thank you Manny!

wdhHKS9cQszR0Yc_hkKJxw.text: It's a beautiful place. Then again in Vegas most of the Restaurants are beautiful. It's not the place that makes this place beautiful it's the people who works her. As soon as you open the door you see beautiful girls with a great smile and welcoming you. Then the person who makes your avocado comes with a great attitude and of course our wonderful waiter that kept coming and asking  to make sure we are ok. HECTOR THANK YOU!! Thank you for your wonderful service.

Gyn3HABO6GsvY8WkhQtKKA.text: The food was very fresh and authentically made very very tasty! The service was outstanding Alexis made the best guacamole, adding fresh garlic and habanero fue to preference. Allan was very attentive and provided great service and Carlos went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and exceeded all expectations!! 100% recommended!

JO85Diy1NCVdhCKmRUYhoA.text: Big place.  Gorgeous view.  Whoever built this joint put a LOT of money into it.  It's a gamble that paid off because we loved this place.  It's obvious that the owner really seems to appreciate providing authentic Mexican dishes to customers.  If you have difficulty making decisions, this is not a great place for you because the selection of food is enormous.  I had the Milanesa--something you don't often find served in Arizona restaurants.  Absolutely fantastic.  If you're looking for some prime Mexican chow on your next trip to Sin City, give this place a whirl.  You'll wish it didn't "stay in Vegas". . .

sTrYSuL0E1YXH6XDtzGoTw.text: Came here twice and always busy but, at least it's good to know they're making their business and those who return enjoy their time there and the food. We know we were satisfied with all our orders and even were able to dine in along their panoramic window, which is a pretty nice view especially when it's the evening time.   Their service is decent and staff who've catered our table were friendly. The restaurant here is spacious but just crowded lol, so make your reservations early or call to find out when's a good time to come. You also can't miss the restaurant as it sits on top of a hill and it's bright orange lol-- good way to spot it.   I say try it once and if you like it, then return with your family and or friends!

ob6DKD4xI51zpZ9Pyclo5Q.text: As good as it gets! This place is great to come to for the view of the Vegas Valley and the strip. Parking is tough here, you might be forced to park on the street. They will put a sombrero on your birthday guest and sing to him/her! Tequila if you are 21! You are served tortilla chips, bean dip, and salsa when you sit down. Don't overeat, or you won't have room for your meal and the food here is top notch! I had the enchiladas with rice & beans. It was excellent! The margaritas here are fantastic! Great place for families and friends. It gets very busy on the weekend nights! This is a good place to watch futbol, and the bar area faces the view of the strip!

VUgm8yPcbGZtaOoH33hUSg.text: Love the live music! Atmosphere is great. View of Vegas from the far end is beautiful day and night. Food is good too. Waiters are wonderful and attentive.

zk71AmD4s1W8VywagG1flw.text: Beautiful outside decor. When you walk in its a really nice establishment. It has a beautiful view of the restaurant. The service was excellent, the food was amazing, and the drinks were delish! Highly recommend this restaurant.

QyxkFJFNkiRpwdRsJEVULA.text: We have found our new favorite restaurant in Henderson! The atmosphere is lively and the interior is spectacular with a view of the city I could watch all day. The meal was some of the best mexican food I've had in Nevada. That table side guacamole is just wonderful and the salsa was delicious. My enchiladas were the same as they come from most mexican food places but eating it there made it taste just a little better. I can't wait to come back.

8RAMitnxmv5X5KWuSk1BlQ.text: We ate here because it was so highly recommended by our friends.  Let me tell you this place did NOT disappoint.  The margaritas were strong and the beer ICE cold.  The food...was outstanding.  The portions were large and everything came out hot.  Their Chile Verde (which is how I judge most Mexican Restaurants) was delicious.  It was seasoned perfect, fell apart and there was plenty of tomatillo sauce to go with it.  My wife had the Camaron Borrachos and they were great too.  Not over cooked and bursting with flavor.  The fresh tortillas are amazing, as well as the red salsa that comes with the chips.  In all honesty if you leave this restaurant hungry then you seriously must have issues.  There is just SO much food they serve.  It was worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Let&#39;s EAT!!!

ZEvlm90Le51idhKzIe5S-A.text: I do not understand the hype about this place. The food is mediocre and the service is so-so.

XxWeP-tdFCAI9ooFUgZiig.text: Excellent. Great location, view, service and food. The menu is extensive covering dishes of all sorts and including dishes that are traditional and hard to find. I had the garlic Fish which was great. It came with freshly made tortillas, rice and beans. It was like being at a good restaurant in Mexico. Took me back.

HJcabkGz-S0kmkgmNxVn3A.text: Through the years my family and I have frequented all of Lindo's restaurants in the Valley. It is simply amazing that the consistency and popularity they have maintained throughout the years. Let a lone a devastating  fire! The community has embraced the Lindo brand and Lindo staff has return the embrace with fast friendly and consistent service.   We have had many of the items on the menu. Fringe tortas to the steak, everything is prepared beautifully. The fresh hand prepared tortillas are delicious! My personal favorite is the chili verde. The pork is delectable with a fantastic depth of flavor. I also like the selection of tequilas they carry. All in all Lindo is great. Give yourself time to find parking. They are always busy. I would say 20 to 30 minutes. It's best to call ahead. Especially if you have a large group.

eWFrmSRyeA3xTC_O1ovWGQ.text: This place is magical. The prices are great and the food was really good. My husband and our I are vegetarian so we didn't eat any meat but the veggie burrito and enchiladas were awesome.  Our sever was Angel and you should all ask for him because he was amazing. The view was fantastic and the parking was good but the parking lot is a bit small and really can't handle all the traffic since the restaurant was very busy.  Oh also chips and salsa were on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Henderson, NV, United States. Michelada with this view

Xgb3HcjZtFBi4wYWIlZhzA.text: Good, fun, family friendly atmosphere! Restaurant is beautiful and prices were less than expected. Food is delicious and service was friendly and efficient. I enjoyed the open kitchen concept. If you are going with children I would suggest before 6pm, after then it tends to be a slightly more boisterous crowd. I wanted to give 4.5 stars, but we all know that's not possible! I didn't want to cheat the place by only giving them 4 though! My suggestion, definitely worth a trip, I would drive 15-20 miles to experience this place!

8qGZWHBV2XqtMjxxEeKGtQ.text: My favorite restaurant!!!!!!! Best food, best service, authentic beautiful design, amazing views, romantic, but also casual and always so lively  Do I have to say more..?

EMuDGtUPsnp_X2o3b415lg.text: Love visiting my dad in Vegas and having him take me on food adventures off the strip! This time around we had dinner at Lindo Michoacan. If you're from out of town and you have your own car and love Mexican food, this is the place to go. It's about a 20-30 min drive off the strip. The restaurant sits on top of hill so if you sit at the bar or behind the bar, you get an amazing view of Las Vegas and the strip! Food was great, service was great, and I look forward to returning with my friends to show them this spot!

Ur_iyH5NVNOccUc3HcmOCA.text: Wow what a view of the strip from the distance. Food was delicious and what I like about this restaurant is variety of fish dishes. Red snapper and salmon were very tasty. Then there was a desert, the servers did light it on fire. I can sum it up that it was very nice place and definitely I am coming back for some more.
